It adjoins the Florida Mall, which is a huge plus for the hotel. It is one of the best malls in central Florida. A few things that I wish they had but currently do not: more tv channels, in room microwave, the tile in the bathrooms is too slippery.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value. Clean and very close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: Floridafirst
Reviews.Content: I shopped all luxury hotels in the Orlando area. I used to live in Orlando so I know where the nicest places are. Last month I stayed at a 5 star hotel at an unbelievable rate and was looking to stay this time in something comparable! Florida Hotel is not new but rates up there when it comes to cleanliness and value. Though you pay a resort fee of about $11 a day additional, you get free Internet all day and night, complimentary water, access to a hotel safe in your room which I could put my lap top in during the day, etc. The staff was great with the exception of a sour faced young doorman who looked liked he lost his best friend. The other bell captain was young, pleasant and eager to please. Oh, if you have a taxi bring you to the hotel at $19.25 from the airport and have to go back out that way via the hotel's cab service (Guido from New York) who obviously has felt their recession will charge you $30 plus and expect a tip for his accent! Please! Anyway, the housekeeping was great and please tip them. They work hard to make your room look nice and make you feel welcome once you return back at the end of the day! I did not eat the food served there. Too many other place to see and visit. However, the parking was a bit troublesome, especially since it is not covered and is out in the mall parking lot. You have to walk up to the hotel to enter which is right in there mall! Overall, I would give this hotel a B+A- Have a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Marcat78
Reviews.Content: We had a chance to take a quick trip with our 4-year-old granddaughter, traveling from Wisconsin to Florida. Although we had to have her practice our word of the week (patients), it was well worth it when we got to the hotel. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The rooms clean and well maintained with never a long delay for the elevators. We visited Disney World and afterwards finished off the afternoon by going to the large hotel pool which is best suited for those over 4 foot tall. Later that evening we walked through the attached mall and enjoyed the many shops. This is a great place for those who want to be fairly close to all the local attractions but would still like to do something within the comfort of your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Service”
Reviews.Author: livenlife2thefullest
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel - very comfortable and the location is perfect. Having a mall and a hotel make the best of both world's and since there is a shuttle to the Disney properties - you really can have it ALL. Thanks for a wonderful week!

Reviews.Title: “Where service is supreme”
Reviews.Author: Southerngirl96
Reviews.Content: Orlando: Florida Hotel and Conference Center Dates: January 4-8, 2009 Reviewer: Trip Advisor member, B'ham, AL We were lucky enough to have great weather in January. My husband was at the hotel for a business meeting, but I was there to play. The Hotel pool area and hot tub were lovely. Service was excellent in Crickets Restaurant near the lobby with nightly two- for- one specials, and staff persons couldn't have been friendlier at the Grab and Go, offering various sundries. Maid service went the extra mile, and the hotel has easy access to the mall and food court and other restaurant options. I also visited Sea World and Discovery Cove very easily. Management reads the comment cards, and I would love to go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: TopGun83
Reviews.Content: I visit the Florida Hotel and conference center very regularly and each time I feel very looked after and welcome. The staff are very friendly and helpful and you get a good banter with the staff at Crickets Bar. You can get an excellent choice of buffet breakfast at the Crickets Bar - ideal before you go shopping. Its far too convenient for words to have the shopping mall right on your doorstep! I would definetly recommend this hotel for anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: msugrad1996
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice and clean. Housekeeping did an exceptional job during the week. Friendly, courteous and helpful staff. Nice to have an in room safe and refrigerator. Proximity to Florida Mall a definite plus!

Reviews.Title: “Very handy location”
Reviews.Author: The_Mellors
Reviews.Content: A great stop off when arriving in Orlando before our drive down to the Gulf Coast - access to the mall until late - lots of choice for dining, however Crickets Bar in the hotel served a very acceptable caesar salad and an excellent breakfast. Good sized rooms - clean and extremely reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “great rooms , clean, safe”
Reviews.Author: madsmoky
Reviews.Content: rooms are nice clean , spacios on the ground of the mall,

Reviews.Title: “Gotta love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarcelMolleman
Reviews.Content: We began our 4 week trip to the states in Orlando, and we booked The Florida Hotel and Conference Center for 3 days. After the first day, to us, it was already made out that we would stay longer in this great hotel. It looks super, the loby, the rooms, and they got an direct entrance to the Mall. They have an heated pool and Spa, wich are also great. The check-in went like a breeze, well everything is just great about this hotel. So we stayed for 7 days, and then we went of to other places. We always refere back to this hotel for ourselves, when we check-in somewhere else. So, the last days of our USA trip we go back to this great hotel, because we want to end our vacation with a great memory of the hotels and the U.S.A. Thanks Florida Hotel, for contributing in a great way! Marcel Molleman The Netherlands

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels we stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Johnny2009
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best hotels we ever went to. The service is exellent as the comfort is. Every part is working fine. Even the internet connection worked 100% really fast. (When you use your laptop, don't forget your network cable because wireless internet is just downstairs at the lobby). The staff is friendly and they have free shuttleservice to Epcot so from there out you can take the free shuttle or monorail to all disneyparks, even downtown Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: sammy090
Reviews.Content: The Florida Hotel and Conference Center was a very pleasureable experience.The front desk and hotel staff enable you to feel at home and at peace because of their attention not only to detail but specifically to their guest and their concerns. So if you are in the Orlando area i would highly recommend that you should make your hotel stay at the Florida Mall and Conference center.

Reviews.Title: “Great Facility”
Reviews.Author: Quest4Fun
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Florida Conference Center while attending a class for my work. The facility is beautiful and well appointed. The staff were all very gracious and accomodating, going out of their way to assist with our every need. The hotel is connected to the mall, so it was very convenient to shop and dine at restaurants off site. Unfortunately, we didn't eat at the hotel's restaurants, so I can't report on that. Considering the location, I was concerned the area may be loud. It was not. There were no interruptions from within the hotel, or from the adjacent mall parking lot. The only negative comment I have is, while the rooms are equipped with mini-refrigerators, there is no microwave in the room. A microwave is available for guest use in the Grab and Go downstairs, but it was a little inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: “Not very happy at Florida Hotel and Conference Center”
Reviews.Author: missfendiuk
Reviews.Content: I booked a quad room with hotelclub.com and upon arriving at the Florida hotel booking in and going to the room i found out that it is only a double room with 1 double bed for 4 people? We were expecting 2 double beds! Well Brandon the front desk manager patronisingly told us that although it is booked and paid for that they do not guarantee that a room for 4 people would be available (although the booking site allows one to choose a quad room and accepts my money and confirms that it is a quad room). Well i then asked for 2 seperate rooms as I had paid for a quad room (to which he said he will charge me for), he then told me he can put in a rollaway but will not charge me for this!!! I accepted as my children who I hyped up this hotel too where looking forlorn and I did not want to disappoint them by going back to our main (lovely hotel Fairfield inn and suites in LBV) as we had only booked the Florida Hotel for 1 night (thank God) so that we can be there for the shopping. The room i requested was no smoking (but smelt like someone had just had a cigar in it). I did not get or were offered cookies like the other posts have mentioned. Even to get the Sunday Orlando sentinel was a problem (i was sent to the left and right side lifts and also to the hotel shop but none were there and no member of staff even cared to look for one, they just sent me on a wild goosechase to find one myself). I asked where I can buy an international card to make overseas calls and was directed to their shop. On buying a card I went back to reception to ask for a phone (public) to use and was told that phones are only in the room (which costs $2 as a standing charge plus 75C a minute to make a free call or local call)!!! Yes, also there is an $8.44 hotel service fee that is non negotiable!! AVOID AVOID AVOID

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: dwafly
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, convenient for Florida Mall, shuttle to the theme parks if that's your thing. I use it for business and its always a pleasure, the staff are friendly and I never have any problems with my room key, cleaning or things missing/broken in the room, it makes a nice change. Also nice touches like complementary water in the rooms, without any tag saying $50 if you even look at it! Only one issue, the room service is a bit pricey, but theres always the food court which is literally 3 minutes from the lobby. Valet service will call reputable taxis for you any time of the day and are always happy to help. Crickets bar and grille is also in the lobby. Some of the friendliest staff I have come across in any hotel bar. I always go for some curly chips and a beer.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Florida Hotel and Conference Center”
Reviews.Author: rotero425
Reviews.Content: We celebrated my daughter's Sweet 16 at the Florida Hotel and stayed for two days at the hotel as well. We had a wonderful time and everything was absolutely beautiful. They were courteous, helpful and patient with us as this was the first time we were involved in such an endeavor. The Catering Manager was most gracious and I felt that I had made a friend. The experience was memorable and I would definitely have another event there. Who knows, maybe in 10 years it will be my daughter's wedding! Thank you for everything!

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: synthia7
Reviews.Content: I have visited this hotel on numerous occasions. On each visit I have experienced employee that exemplify the greatest customer service going out of their way to asist us in any way they could. From the front desk to the room workers all seemed to take their jobs sereously. Thats good! I travel a lot in and out of the USA. One of the things that makes me return to a hotel is the custermer service. This tells me a lot about the management of a place. If the employees are going above and beyond then the managemnt will do the same. I appreciate the opportunity to provide positive feedback you and your company. I plan to visit again. Respectfully Synthia Williams

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay at the Florida Hotel and Conference Center”
Reviews.Author: AnneAndrea
Reviews.Content: My sister and I have just returned from our annual trip to fabulous Florida. As usual we spent the last few days of our holiday at the Florida Hotel and Conference Center and we weren't disappointed. The service was excellent from the young man who so pleasantly checked us in (was it Mark?) to the gentleman who fried our eggs to perfection (George) and gave us a lesson in waffle making to the good natured Hungarian bell boy who transported our heaving suitcases with ease. The rooms were spacious, modern and spotless and the beds were oh so comfortable. The flat screen tv was a nice touch and the safe and 'fridge included as standard. For shoppers, like my sister and I, the hotel is perfectly situated attached to the mall and my goodness there are some great bargains to be had! Last year when we stayed, I complained the only fault was that the pool was a little on the cool side for comfort. This year it was perfect. Well done for listening Florida Hotel and Conference Centre - I can't wait to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Florida Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gatorchik123
Reviews.Content: The room was spotless. The staff are friendly and courteous. The hotel itself is beautiful. It was a nice treat to have Starbucks in the hotel and the mall to shop. This is an absolutely wonderful place that I would without reservation recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaJames
Reviews.Content: Rude staff, fees, fees, fees and hidden charges, bait and switch on the rooms, loud - hear highway traffic and other rooms. Their big draw is the mall that they are connected to but you are competeing for parking with MALL SHOPPERS! I don't need to say more about that. OH - unless you want to PAY for valet parking and forced to use their bell service that you get charged for. The bellman charged me $15 for bags that we wanted to carry ourselves. Tried to speak with management and they wouldn't come out. The staff act like they are doing you a giant favor by showing up to work - very rude and couldn't care less that we were there. Don't stay here - you will NOT like it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and Comfortable Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: afleming660
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Florida Hotel for 3 nights, gathering with family to go to the parks and other attractions. Hotel is very clean and comfortable, and convenient to many things, most especially the mall! We definitely plan to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “My favourite US hotel”
Reviews.Author: goldie1804
Reviews.Content: This was our 6th stay at the hotel, and we were treated like family when we arrived. The hotel is very clean and comfortable, and the staff cannot do enough for you. The cookies on reception on arrival are a really nice gesture, and nothing is too much trouble. hotel is in a great location, especially for the Black Friday Sales! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, as they make everything so easy from booking through to check out. Thanks for a fantastic stay

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Florida Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IrishMarie
Reviews.Content: I was bowled over by the kindness of the staff members at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice price, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tobben_8
Reviews.Content: Although the main purpose of the visit was to attend a conference in another part of town and I thus started the stay with some disappointment that the agency had found me this hotel, I soon came into a better mood. The first really positive impression was something as insignificant as the clothes hangers. They were the real thing, not those that imply you're going to steal them if they are not secured, and they were plentiful and of several categories in a roomy closet. The next was the Internet hookup. It cost nothing, was very quick and straightforward and to my amazement it worked perfectly every time I turned on the pc. On the positive side were also the hotel's limo drivers. They cost less than a taxi, knew the city and area really well and were always friendly and on time. High degree of cleanliness (even the windows were clean) and the hotel has a nice warm pool with plentiful towels. They could have dropped the rather loud music in the pool area though. The breakfast experience was good, with a resident cook to prepare egg dishes. When the same premises are converted into a bar in the evening on the other hand, the result is somewhat lacking. Martinis on a breakfast table? Altogether, however, I stayed five nights and had a very satisfactory experience at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Sue144
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at the Florida Hotel and Conference Centre located in the Florida Mall. Great location for all the shops with plenty of space for parking. Only 10 mins drive from the airport so ideal if you don't fancy a long drive after the flight and you are tired. Staff very friendly and can not do enough to help if you should encounter any small problems. We always stay here after and before our long haul flights especially if we are travelling on and not staying in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Great Service !”
Reviews.Author: A330FO
Reviews.Content: Being an airline pilot, I know what I'm talking about when I refer to hotels. The Florida Hotel and Conference Center definitely stands above average, with EXCELLENT location (shops, restaurants, Disney Parks and so on). The staff simply couldn't be more attentious and friendly! In regards to rooms, lobby and pool area, they were just immaculate! On my next vacation period, I consider taking my family to Disney, and The Florida Hotel will definitely be on the plans !

Reviews.Title: “Very good place to stay for the right price”
Reviews.Author: ashtilman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel in the beginning of October as part of a four day vacation in Orlando. The biggest advantage of the hotel is the fact that is located inside a great shopping mall!!! (For people that like shopping). The hotel is located 15 minutes from Universal and Disney parks, so it is cheaper to go by Taxi then to rent a car ($25 each ride to the parks). The hotel room is very average, nothing special. Exactly what you should expect from an hotel in this price range. The only thing bothered me in the hotel was the fact that he hallway was very dirtyâ€¦ there were sheets and room service dishes that were lying there for a couple of days before someone picked them up. Overall it is a good hotel, in case you pay around $150. If it is more expensive you should look at alternatives because it is not â€œgreatâ€�. I would go back there in case the price will be right. .

Reviews.Title: “Love the florida hotel”
Reviews.Author: susanj0y
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel about 6 times. We returned from there last Saturday. For the past couple of years we have always started our holiday at this hotel for one night before heading off for the gulf coast, and ending our holiday there for 2 nights. This hotel is situated in an ideal position leading on to the Florida Mall (my favourite shopping mall). The rooms are large and the bathrooms an ideal size.The beds are very comfortable and the plasma tv screen a bonus. The reception staff are very friendly in particular Ray. The pool is a good size with plenty of towels. You have to use your room key to enter the pool and it has plenty of comfortable sunloungers. This time we had a problem with our safe.The security man came up to the room but he could not open it. Brandon, one of the managers became involved and sorted the problem out in a helpful and professional manner. Crickets restaurant was handy for breakfast. There is a shop in the foyer which sells newspapers, groceries and even the lottery. This hotel is one of the best we have every stayed at. We love the Florida hotel and cannot wait to go back again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Fine stay for the right price”
Reviews.Author: londonrookie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over a long weekend. You would want to have a car to get around the area. The price for the room was good ($99 from Travel Zoo site). However, the automatic daily bottled-water fee was a turn off. Also, they had a problem with the complimentary buffet breakfast tickets, and the buffet fare was no big deal. Seems as though this is a conference hotel for large groups as well as airline staff layovers. Never got to see the pool area. Being connected to the super mall was a plus in case you are burnt out from the parks or to stay out of the Florida heat. My SO liked this feature!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: abbyLondon
Reviews.Content: Great clean hotel. Conveniently attached to shopping mall which was handy for days when you didnt want to leave hotel and go out for dinner this was perfect nice restaurants inside mall. Has a panera bread opposite mall great for bagels,pastries, fresh breads etc reasonably priced food would recommend great salad selections also. Hotel only provides shuttles to Epcot but that worked fine for us. couldnt get enough of Florida mall so may shops and stores rolled into one place! Great beauty salons in mall for that extra pampering. would recommend this hotel if you love your shopping. Main parks nearby. Great friendly front desk allways were helpful. will return very soon to florida mall hotel. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good Price, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mark_Ref
Reviews.Content: Hotel is conencted to the Mall and is minutes from Universal or the I-4 to get you to all other attractions. We paid 125$ which we found very good for the high class of hotel. It is very clean and updated. Great for families or couples. We will make this a stop again.

Reviews.Title: “a cold place”
Reviews.Author: tania27
Reviews.Content: we had staid here a year ago, but things where not good so we complained to the manager, she emailed us and phoned us to put things right, we got a 1 nights free stay which we took on the 23rd of may 2008. the rooms are lovely , but this hotel is a cold place, the staff dont speak, and the halls are very creepy, every thing looks the same, when yougot to the pool you go through the lobby where every one is going shopping and there you are dripping wet and in your swim suite. the good thing s are you can go shop and then come back and drop in to your big big very big bed. this place is ok for one nights shopping but not for abase for a full orlando holiday. not for me,

Reviews.Title: “100% Would Return”
Reviews.Author: MIL0417
Reviews.Content: I was the coordinator for a meeting that was held at the Florida Hotel and Conference Center from May 12-15, 2008. I cannot say enough good things about the hotel, staff, and location. The hotel, lodging rooms, and meeting space are very clean. I cannot brag enough about my Sales representative (Patty) and Banquet Coordinator (Sheila) that made my meeting a success!! The hotel has two restaurants. Cricketts is a fantastic place to grab a good meal and a drink. The staff at Cricketts are terrific (Crickett, Havera, and Liz). If you don't want to dine at the hotel which I highly recommend, you can eat in the mall. The mall has the food court and higher end restaurants. The area that surrounds the mall has plenty of places for dining. The pool is very, very clean and secured. Even the valet drivers were friendly and helpful. I coordinate alot of meetings and I would highly recommend this hotel for conferences and vacations. I received alot of positive feedback on the Florida Hotel from my attendees and plan to use this facility again. Do yourself a favor and go there because this place has something for everyone!

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: Golant
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a bed and breakfast package booked last minute for $100 and felt it was good value at this rate(best rate was through hotels own website). We were looking to do a bit of shopping and then a visit to universal and so opted to stay here as just us two adults and so hoped we may avoid the inevitable hoards of children! The hotel seemed to be mainly business, airline staff and couples so all very calm and peaceful. Enjoyed the convience to the shops and although the gates to the mall do shut it's not till 9.30pm so not a problem for us. Breakfast was a buffet with very good selection of hot and cold and as included in package but costs around $15 per person for the full works if not included made rate seem even better. Room was clean and good size, only note would be the bathroom was a bit on the dark side. Nice flat screen tvs and fridge with ice box which could be useful. Overall wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Florida Hotel And Conference Center”
Reviews.Author: todcyn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel to attend a conference being held there. Orlando can be hard for me to navigate, but the hotel was very easy to find from Interstate 4, which I appreciated. It is connected to the Florida Mall, which made for a good conference location. I was alone on this trip and I had something to do in the evenings without leaving the property. I was impressed by the rooms initially, but the longer I was there the more lack of maintenance I noticed. This was especiallly in the conference rooms, which had HVAC vents that were rusted, water spots on the ceiling, etc. The fitness room was terrible, considering the size of this hotel. There are 11 floors (I don't know how many rooms), full banquet and conference facility, a restaurant, Starbucks, etc., but the fitness room was the size of a regular room with very few options for machines. The staff was all very nice, but they request that you complete a comment card for every single service provided, which gets a little old. I guess I would stay there again, but if you are going to Orlando for the theme parks, this is only close to Universal and Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “Check the mall hours!!”
Reviews.Author: gasunshine229
Reviews.Content: This property was actually very good, for the money. We loved staying at the mall. The accomodations were very clean and the employees were all outstanding, except the security officer. It was really a great place to stay. However, the hotel/mall entrance closes unexpectedly (there is an obscure sign at the gate). Any guest caught on the mall side will have to find their way back to the front of the hotel, IN THE DARK!!! The hotel security officer was very offensive, even after we showed him our hotel key. Fortunately, I was there with my family. Had I been a single woman in that situation, I would have been much more upset. There was no offer to send someone around or call Mall security for help. Due to the close proximity to the airport, there were several flight attendants that came to the rescue. They showed us how to get back around to the entrance, obviously it happens a lot. We all filed a complaint. Hopefully, management will address the issue. In the meantime, just be careful and check the closing times posted.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced room in a mall”
Reviews.Author: AtlantanHaggis
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a conference I was attending. Overall, the hotel was adequate and the conference rooms were quite nice. The staff at the hotel were attentive and assisted me whenever I needed help. The rooms were also quite nice, in that they are spacious, decorated well, and include a flatscreen tv and internet access. Contrary to a previous review, I found that there was plenty of parking and the lot was full not once during my stay. However, this completes the good things I had to say about the hotel. The area around the hotel was quite seedy and your choice of dinner location is limited if you do not have a car in the area. This might be fine for someone who doesn't mind getting a taxi to dinner each night, but I am person who prefers to walk. This may just be personal preference. Our room was dirty when we arrived and the bathroom had obviously not been cleaned prior to our arrival. That was the low point. Furthermore, I did not agree with the MANDATORY 7.50$ fee we were charged each night for "access to the gym," "2 water bottles each day," and "internet access." This seems hardly fair to tack on an indisputable charge each night on top of the room and tax. All in all, the hotel is "okay." Perhaps my expectations were a bit too high from previous stays in higher quality and nicer hotels at similar prices. Others may find this hotel perfectly adequate, depending on your expectations; yet, I think the price per night is far too high for the quality you get.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Nice”
Reviews.Author: Dogfish60min
Reviews.Content: This was one of the closest hotels I could find to a conference I was attending that was not very overpriced. I was wary at first, considering that is co-located with the Florida Mall. However, I was very pleased with the quality of the rooms. While certainly not the most conveniently located to many attractions, this is a good option for the price if you are willing to have to travel a bit. As with most hotels in Orlando, just be aware that requesting a cab or taxi from the valet will get you a more highly priced town car. It appears that most of the hotels have a relationship with the town car company, so you will need to call a cab yourself if you do not want the town car.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the Name Suggests”
Reviews.Author: Skovelli
Reviews.Content: When you hear a simply named place like "The Florida Hotel" you might think - eew, small, dark, old. But the Florida Hotel is excellent. The beds are perfectly comfortable, the rooms are quiet, and the flat screen tv was a nice surprise. Room rates are comparable for the area. Also, the pool is perfectly adequate - tho I wish they had a pool bar. It is adjacent to the Florida Mall, so you have easy access to a Food Court if that's your type of meal. For more upscale dining, you're just 5 minutes from incredible restaurants on W. Sand Lake. Brian at the check-in counter is AWESOME! He went way overboard in helping us make dinner reservations for business. His restaurant suggestions were impeccable - for business and for pleasure. Whenever I have business reasons to stay on this side of Orlando, I will definitely make this my home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: scarlett329
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for only 1 night in January on business. We found everything to be very nice. We walked around the mall for a very long time. There are a lot of places to eat in the food court if that's what you want. There were a lot of places to eat up and down the main road. I did hear someone at the check out desk about being charged for 2 bottles of water. So, I guess if you're going to get charged $7.50 for 2 bottles of water than you might as well take them. Maybe it's just me, but the roads around the Orlando Airport are a nightmare. I'm a tried and true believer in MapQuest, but I think even for them it was a challenge giving directions from the airport to this hotel. The hotel is situated on a road that winds behind the Mall so it's a bit tricky. We didn't use any of the facilities and there was only 1 restaurant and 1 coffee shop in the hotel itself. I messed up a little When I reserved the room/pkg. that included a free breakfast buffet, I apparently only checked that there was 1 person in the room instead of 2 so I pointed that out to the gal at the front desk and she wouldn't give me another voucher for breakfast, which was okay since it was my fault. However, the awesome Buffet Manager woman (I feel bad that I forgot her name) did not charge me for my breakfast buffet..she said that was silly that they didn't give us 2 anyway. This hotel,in my opinion is NOT in the heart of the whole Disney tourist epicenter. It is more of a nice place to stay for business since it does have a convention center. Hope this helps someone:)

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: NeeneeOrlando
Reviews.Content: I secured a room at this hotel for out-of-state visitors as my guest room is under rehab. The front desk staff is unbelievably slow and the grounds are not well-kept. The rooms are okay but overpriced for the lack of amenities. Being charged $181 per night for an average room is ridiculous; a fee of $7.50 per night for bottled water, coffee packets and internet access is downright gouging us; charging for local phone calls is entirely too greedy! Our complaints went unheeded and trying to rectify things after checkout only resulted in rudeness upon the part of the reservations clerk. I cannot recommend this hotel nor will I ever put up guests there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HappyWanderer08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for an event, and it was very nice. The location at the mall was great. The most outstanding thing was the customer service at the registration desk. Several different staff members patiently and competently answered our questions, made recommendations, and arranged transportation - always with a smile on their faces! There was a free shuttle to Disney World. The rooms are not luxurious, but are of reasonable size and were clean and comfortable. The one notable negative was the service in the casual dining restaurant. We went there more than once (out of scheduling necessities.) The food was adequate, but the service was ABOMINABLE!! The waitstaff was unfriendly and incompetent. I'm guessing that this restaurant (Cricket's Grille) must be contracted out to another enterprise, because there's no way that the staff of the restaurant have the same management as the front desk/concierge staff. On the upside, the mall had a lot of reasonable dining choices, so you don't really have to eat in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: truck06
Reviews.Content: Just a couple of things to add to previous positive postings. The fitness center is well equipped with cardio equip, but is lacking in free weights. Two benches, which incline, but the dumbbells only go up to 30 lbs. King bed room had refrigerator, but no microwave. There is a Publix grocery store a short drive or long walk, so one has to be careful about what to take back to the room. If you don't bring a computer, there was only one laptop at the front desk with intermittent problems, and you had to stand to use it, which may have shortened the amount of time some people used. Outdoor pool was not heated. Cricketts Lounge had 2 for one happy hour specials, as did Ruby Tuesday on the other side of the mall. Complimentary paper was in the lobby, not dropped off at the room. Hallways and meeting rooms were freezing. The bedcovers are so warm that we had to turn the air down to 60 degrees just to sleep comfortably. All in all, this was a very good hotel and I enjoyed my conference.

Reviews.Title: “My Fave Hotel of the whole vacation!”
Reviews.Author: lovinghotels86
Reviews.Content: My family and I visited this hotel during our week long vacation in Florida in March 2007. I greatly enjoyed this hotel! Being one of the cheaper hotels in Orlando ( they all tend to be high priced ), I didn't expect much, wow, was I wrong! The outside is gorgeous at night, and the outside pool is amazing! There is even a palm tree in the middle of the lobby! Comfortable beds, clean, spacious rooms! I LOVED the plasma TV! We were also fortunate to have a room with a good view! The staff was very friendly and helpful, seeming how we didn't know our way around Orlando very well. I also took advantage of a Starbucks being right downstairs in the morning. The hotel management left a survey for visitors to fill out and write comments on how they could make our visit more pleasant. I suggested that they have full length mirrors outside of the bathroom so other people could get ready at the same time. A few weeks later, I got a letter in the mail informing me that full length mirrors were being put into all of the rooms in the hotel. EXCELLENT customer service on their behalf!!!! I can, without a doubt, say that if I ever visit Orlando again, that will be the first place I book a room!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but watch out for the "Service Fee"”
Reviews.Author: SiouxSue
Reviews.Content: If it weren't for the service fees, I'd be giving this hotel a great review. It's a large, but pretty quiet, hotel attached to a fabulous mall (Nordstrom's, Macy's, etc.). I stayed here attending a 4-day conference that was happening in the hotel. Check in was very smooth at a very large circular "desk." The room was very nice: * Large with lots of windows (and effective curtains) * Very nice, large desk with a free high-speed, trouble-free Internet connection * Comfy bed with lots of pillows * Small, empty refridgerator where you can store water and/or the left-overs from room service meals - not a rip-off stuffed full of tiny liquor bottles and $5 cans of soft drinks and candy bars in it. * Safe in the room (would hold a computer somewhat larger than my 7.5" x 11" travel Dell) * Nice, big bathroom with marble floors and counter, tub and shower combination * Comfortable couch and coffee table in addition to the desk * Doorbell for the room Nice Starbucks in the lobby. Cricket's bar/restaurant also in the lobby. (Be sure to say hi to Cricket - they named the bar after her and she's very nice.) However, watch out in Cricket's - they add an 18% "service fee" to the bill when you receive it, so don't do your usual tip on top of that or you'll really be over-paying! Room service is good. It was a long wait one evening for the fruit plate and had a $2 fee plus an 18% service fee added to the bill (not unusual, in my experience). The mall is excellent, but beware if you eat a late dinner at the excellent Italian restaurant in the mall (Buca?). We walked back through the mall, but couldn't get back into the hotel without going through some maintenance corridors to the outside and then walking around to the front of the hotel. The hotel closes their entrance to the mall at 6:30 on Sundays and 9:30 on other days. They ask you to accept changing the sheets every couple of days rather than every day. And, they also ask you to re-use towels in the bathroom from day to day. All in the interests of conserving energy, etc. OK. I don't change the sheets every day at home, and I do re-use the towels at home. HOWEVER, my bill had a $5 fee added every night for "services" I never used. And management would NOT waive the DAILY fee. The fee covered - * use of the swimming pool (didn't use the pool) * use of the shuttles to the attractions (never visited any attractions) * the water in the room (2 bottles of water sat on top of the refridgerator, unused, untill the last day when I realized I was paying for them whether or not I used them) * the local newspaper which was available for you to pick up every morning by the elevator in the lobby (not even delivered to the room!) Be on guard for the extra fees they slip into the bills. When you check in, ask about that water! There wasn't a price on it or an indication that it was included in the cost of the room. It struck me as sneaky. The manager implied that the conference got a reduced room rate so the hotel had to charge extra for the other hotel features that they provided, even if those features weren't used. Balderdash, as my grandmother would say. All in all, a very good hotel, and I would gladly stay in it again. Except for those *^#&$&#* fees! At a minimum, I'd drink that water, and grab that newspaper next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: BettyS
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter here for a birthday shopping trip. It was perfect -- we could shop and rest, have dinner, and spend time together. We did not use the pool or restaurant but both looked quite nice. We will surely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “worst experience ever!! lawsuit pending”
Reviews.Author: Melikins
Reviews.Content: i was staying at this hotel for a business trip.. at first it was stunning i arrived on tuesday.. wednesday when i woke up i had a bite over my right eye and two one my left side.. really didnt think anything of it.. thursday when i woke up my eye was swollen shut and the bites on my side were swollen to the size of golf balls.. the hotel called an ambulance and sent me to the hospital..and they changed my room.. i spent the next few days in bed missing work because i was deathly sick and on 3 different medications.. i checked out on sunday and still was extremely sick.. havent returned to work yet because i am still ill.. and the hotel is doing nothing about the medical bills or the time i have to be out of work because of something at their hotel biting me..!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: KeithYubaCity_Ca
Reviews.Content: My wife suggested that we attend the Pepsi 400 NASCAR race at Daytona this year so she asked me to make reservations and get the tickets. Well I contacted Race.com for our tickets and the packaghe that we got booked us into the Florida Hotel. When my family and I which not only included my wife and I but our 2 daughters 18 and 16 pulled up we were impressed at what we were looking at. Then we went inside and was immediately greated byv there desk staff who were very friendly and curtious. He answered all our questions and even had a message for me that was left earlier in the day. We entered our room and it was perfect. I turned on the AC and withing just a coup;e of minutes the room was cool. We did have one small issue in that when we took our shower it would not drain properly. So I advised the front desk as we were leaving for the race and when we returned that night I had a message advsing me that the drain in the shower had been fixed. I have nothing but good things to say about the Florida Hotel in fact we stayed there an extra 2 days and I would most definitely stay there again as well as recommend others to stay. There is something I should let you all know about so you do not get ripped off. The first is the restaurant 'Cricket" what ever you do I would not recommend that you eat breakfast there. It is $13.95 for a buffet breakfast and the food is not that great for what you have to pay. I made the mistake and ate there with my 2 daughters and with just the 3 of us and one of my daughtets just ordering breakfast off the menu our bill was $46.00 and the daughter who ordered breakfast did not gte her meal until after myself and my other daughter ate our breakfast and got seconds.And secondly do not buy your tickets to any of the venues from the ticket agent at the main desk. I should say tyhis agent is not an employee of the Florida Hotel. But what they do is presure you into trying to get you to buy property and a vacation home. Now if you sit throught their 90 minutes brainwashing you can get a fairly good deal on tickets. But if you just want to buy the tickets so you do not have to stand in the ticket lines I suggest you stand in the lines. The cost to get into Disney World through the person selling tickets at the hotel is $77.00 but when yoiu show up at the park you will see that the day ticket is only $67.00. So I suggest if you do not want to sit and listen to their speech and show and tell you buy your tickets at the parks. But for the hotel itself it was a great pleasure instaying there as my wife can attest since she and the kids visited the mall several times. As I stated above I cannot say nothing negative about the hotel or its staff. It also provides a free shuttle to several of the Parks such as Disney World, Universal Studios, Epcot, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: mosquitomagnet
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in mid-June. The hotel is centrally located and it was easy to get to all the attractions. We liked that the hotel is connected to the Florida Mall. The food court is right outside the lobby entrance and there were plenty of restaurant choices as well. The room was very clean and comfortable. There is a nice sized refrigerator. The pool was big however you had to get there early in the morning if you wanted chairs. I would have no qualms about staying at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Too Hot To Sleep There”
Reviews.Author: we0219
Reviews.Content: My husband was attending a conference at the hotel so the kids and I joined him for what we thought would be a relaxing few days. The lobby is very nice and the pool was small but pretty. We went to our room which was not very big and it was hot. We turned the air down to 65 and left for a while. When we returned, the hallway was still colder then the room was. We called the front desk and the said they would send someone to check on it. We went out for dinner and when we came back it was still not cool. We called the desk again and they sent maintenance up. The man explained to us that the units are set to only cool when they detect body heat in the room, the rest of the time they don't blow cold air. He opened up all of the vents to help circulate the air. He said all of the rooms were like that and many people had been complaining. It was very uncomfortable sleeping in a warm room, not to mention the beds are only full size and don't really accomodate 2 adults. The next morning we asked to be moved to another room but their weren't any available. They had no other suggestions and didn't really seem to care about the problem. Unfortunately, we had 1 more night there so we bought an air mattress so one of our kids could sleep on it and my youngest slept with me so my husband could have some room in the bed. After speaking to other families attending the same conference, they all had the same complaints about the air conditioner and small beds. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone nor would I ever stay there again. Its only redeeming quality is that it is attached to the Florida Mall but International Drive is only 5 minutes away and full of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DB377
Reviews.Content: The staff has always been very courteous. I mean everyone from the bellmen, front desk, house keeping, and maintenance. The rooms are large and do not feel like a shoe box. The beds are comfortable and the showers are hot. I love the Dasani water available in the room. I also like the refrigerators and televisions. However... I stayed here before the renovation. I was very excited when I heard about the make over. Unfortunately, I am disappointed in the final result. I have noticed that the carpets in the hallways are loose. At first, I thought it was isolated to 1 floor, but after multiple stays, it is on multiple floors. I also was disappointed on my last visit. The entire toilet paper holder was not attached to the wall. I set it on the floor 2 days in a row in hopes that housekeeping would have it repaired. To my surprise, they kept sticking it on the wall and literally when I came back to my room, EVERY piece came flying off of the wall when I needed paper. I called Housekeeping and literally within minutes the guy fixed it. I interpreted this as a sign that there is a lack of pride with the maid staff. The last two rooms that I stayed in had ineffective AC controls. I never could get the room to cool to 68, even after leaving it on all night. The hallway is actually cooler this week. This week my bathtub has the faucet 1" away from the wall. Every morning, I have tried to push it back. When I come back to my room, the faucet has been turned to a 7:00 position and is still detached from the wall. In addition to that, the temperature indicator is not secured to the handle and it just spins around. The parking is not customer friendly either. Every time I have been here, there are only a handful of cars in the valet area. The valet area is huge. I have never witnessed it over 20% full. It seems that they would give up that remaining 80% to paying guests. And as they increase the valet parking, they could increase the lot area. As it is now, I have to park a couple hundred meters away from the hotel and walk next to a valet parking lot that is 80% empty, which has no revenue generating impact, and is a poor way to treat customers. Ultimately, it is disappointing that they spent millions in the renovation project because it is the little details that continuously go unnoticed.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: RASSIG
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is great . The staff is nice and friendly . The room was very clean the bed is amazing very confortable and there was a big plasma TV . The internet acess was free with your own laptop , free self parking and teh hotel is located inside the Florida Mall who has nice restaurants and very good stores . I loved it .

Reviews.Title: “A NIGHTMARE!”
Reviews.Author: Coolwindzephyr
Reviews.Content: Hi! This was one of the WORST hotels that I have ever been to!! I took the advice of the people who had posted "excellent" comments about it and I was HORRIFIED when I arrived at the hotel. THEY ALL LIED! This hotel is so old and is in need of renovation (they said it has been..OKKKK)! The mall is not all that either. But, if you just want to go look around at Macy's or Dillardâ€™s....OK. I'm sure you have a Macy's and Dillardâ€™s where you live, so what's the big deal? BORING! When my sister and I first arrived, we were given a room that was awful! It smelled awful in there and there were stains all over the sheets. The view was awful, too! We opened the window only to see a roof top that looked all moldy and nasty--some view, huh? We immediately called the front desk and told the guy who worked there (he had an attitude). He said they only had ONE room left in the WHOLE hotel (yeah right) and he could transfer us. It was supposed to be one of their "better rooms," I guess. Well, we ended up transferring to it which was a little better than the first, but I was still not impressed. The bathroom was gross! The tile was nasty and had mold between it. After showering, I felt dirtier than I did in the beginning! And get this, the covers were stained in this room, too--looked like blood! I requested new sheets and a comforter. The price is way too high to be staying in such a place! We couldn't get our money back though. The hotel staff was not helpful at all. I called the front desk for information about nearby stores in the area because my sister needed Tylenol. The receptionist told me to go to a gas station to get them. After I walked MILES to a gas station down the road, I found out the next day that there was a CVS Pharmacy in the mall!! I was so mad! How come the front desk didn't know it was there?? How stupid is that? ....BLAH...The breakfast was OK, but it was overpriced and the guy who made omelets didn't know what on EARTH he was doing. It was sad! Our weekend trip (Thank God it was only 2 days) to Orlando was HORRIBLE and I will NEVER stay at this hotel again. I don't recommend that anyone stay at this location! Don't believe the "good" reviews you read about the hotel being very nice and pleasant! It was AWFUL! It smells bad and the carpet is FILTHY in the halls. These people who post "excellent" must be used to staying at crappy hotels to think that this place is superior! I will NEVER visit Orlando again either. There's NOTHING there. If it wasn't for the theme parks, it would be a complete ghost town. There's nothing there but failing businesses... It's so slummy! I thought it would be nice, but I was wrong. Having visited Southern California so many times and then going to a place like this was SHOCKING!!! I thought there would be a similarity--WRONG AGAIN!! Anyway, don't stay at this hotel. KEEP LOOKING!!!! And if you can help it, don't go to Florida!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not very convenient.....”
Reviews.Author: JohnsonSeattle
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and the area was ok. The Mall attached to the hotel is very nice and upscale. Kind of a tourist trap as prices were higher in this mall than what I have seen in other places but what do you expect with its proximity to Disney. The problem was really its distance from the Convention Center. The traffic was terrible getting too and from here so if you have plans to go to the Convention Center or Disney I wouldn't stay here. If you are staying at the convention center get something on I-Drive or Universal Drive as close to the Convention Center as possible so you don't have to drive. If you are going to Disney stay at Disney as it will be worth the headache of trying to navigate the traffic. Having said all of this if your plans don't include going to either of the before mentioned places I would recommend this hotel as it was clean and the shopping was right there.

Reviews.Title: “More pluses then minuses”
Reviews.Author: Marius40
Reviews.Content: I stayed here January 31-February 2, 2007 for a business meeting. PROS: Free Parking Free Shuttle to Disney Parks Many reasonable restaurants in mall food court Starbucks in lobby Decent workout room, Life Fitness equipment, a few free weights In-room safe (no charge) In-room refrigerator New, wall mounted TV's Free high speed internet access CONS: Unless you love shopping (it is just a mall), no movie theatres etc. Nothing else around, except chain restaurants Requested a king room (four months ago), told they were sold out. No affiliation with any hotel reward program One tip: We had a rental car, however there is a shuttle from the airport which is less then 10 minutes away, $23.00 round trip. Hope this helps. Cheers.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: heathjp
Reviews.Content: Hotel has been renovated since it was the Adam's Mark; upgraded room was somewhat larger with a sofa. Overall, an average hotel attached to a pretty nice mall. Check in was competent.

Reviews.Title: “Getting to the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: caseylou
Reviews.Content: We flew into Orlando and took a taxi to the Florida Hotel. This hotel we booked through Royal Caribbean as we were going on a cruise the next day. The hotel itself is very nice and attached to a huge Mall. The taxi ride from Orlando Airport to the hotel was $27.00! Although the hotel was nice I would only go there again if the hotel offered a shuttle from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KAO2002
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Florida Hotel. The lobby is attached to a great mall. The rooms were very comfortable, with a featherbed and blanket. The flat panel LCD tv was a nice touch. The bathroom is all done in granite. To top it all off there is even an empty counterheight mini refrigerator all ready to store your food. There is also internet access included in the room price.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with hard beds”
Reviews.Author: BornToTravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a business stay Jan 11-13. The location in the Florida Mall was very convenient. The room was clean and well appointed. The flat panel LCD TV on the wall was a nice touch. The room had a "door bell" where you could also indicate from inside the room whether you wanted the room clenaed or did not want to be disturbed. The chosen message displayed outside your room. My only complaint was that my mattress was very hard. After reading other reviews and talking to one of my co-workers (who had a pillow top mattress) it seems my mattress was just not replaced yet during their renovation. I would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Business Hotel Excellent for Tourists”
Reviews.Author: Kaski
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent business hotel which offered us a very good rate during the holidays, i.e. when there are few business travellers. The only word of caution is about the concierges (or guest advisors) who went into "hard-sell" mode every time we asked them a question, mostly for visits to timeshare property sales events, but we were also irritated by the fact that all the "personally recommended" restaurants were owned by the same group. Also, the theme park tickets were not discounted as promised -- better buy them at the Orlando Visitor's Center.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but the beds are hard and the walls are thin”
Reviews.Author: Julie513
Reviews.Content: Overall I would say the hotel is average. The beds are hard and the walls are thin, but I have stayed in worse. The bathroom was nice and so were the furnishings. But, I had to wear earplugs because it was so noisy. I could hear the "ding" of the elevator arriving on my floor from 10 rooms down. That is redicuous.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: debbie_smith22
Reviews.Content: My friend and I went down to Orlado with the red cross to be in place in case tropical strom ernesto gained strength. We got to stay at the Florida hotel and conference center. This place was no doubt the best hotel I ever stayed at. We stayed 3 nights and every morning that I woke up I was free of back and leg pain. (first time in over 4 years) The beds have down comforters and pads. My friend fell asleep almost instantly. (which is very rare for her). The staff are wonderful people very friendily and always asking if there is anything they could do for us. Our room was spotless , no mold or dirt. When I go on vacation to florida next year I will be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: pepsi_enya
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Florida Mall Hotel for a week in October. The hotel was lovely and looked very clean. We had a twin double room, which was spacious and clean. The staff always seemed friendly and nice. The bonus of this hotel for all you shoppers was that it was attached to the Mall, where you can shop till you drop!! There are also a number a restaurants within walking distance of the hotel (outside the complex). It was a great location and close to the I4 (which we used a LOT). We wouldn't hesitate to go back to this hotel it good for the young old and families.

Reviews.Title: “super”
Reviews.Author: ellenrw
Reviews.Content: super hotel, ok no disney atmosphere but great location right into the mall. the bar in the evening had a good atmosphere due to alot of airline staff staying here, would go back to this hotel again especially if you want to be out of all the hussle and bussle of disney. we had no kids with us and it was a nice quite hotel for us with the choice of the hotel bar or orlando ale house across the car park and rugby tuesdays in the mall. rooms spotless and good size for two people maybe 3

Reviews.Title: “Playing Hotel vs. Running One”
Reviews.Author: ladydocinchitown
Reviews.Content: Nothing to scream problematic, but way too many near misses to warrant satisfaction. Those that seem pleased probably don't travel much and most assuredly don't do so for business. * From the front desk that seems content to speak to one another rather than check in guests * To the desk attendants that immediately ask for your photo id and credit card, even if you have already supplied them with it (they get irritated if you point this out - okay this is a pet peeve of mine - it may not bntoher others) * To the valet parking - which takes far longer than walking the requisite 1+ miles to the self-parking lot * To the parking lot that appears as if it survived a missle attack and was never repaved. * To the carpeting that has faded to some color not found in nature. * To the glorious noise * To the dust bunnies behind the bed and other places I was scared to look * To the newly refubished rooms that were done so as cheaply as possible. * To the room service attendant that puts you on hold because they don't know what soft drinks are available and need 10 minutes to check * To the room service order that arrives late, and isn't what you ordered. * To the televisions that while a flat panel, and pretty, don't always work. * To the restaurant personnel who chase you down to your room because they can't figure out how to split a bill between two credit cards (explain that to a colleague/client). * To the housekeeping service that doesn't get to your room until 7:30 at night because they had a busy day. * To the air conditioners that never get the room cool enough or all the humditity out of it, and the maintenance crew who always shrugs their shoulders to say, I don't know why it isn't cooler in here...seems to be working fine. I could go on, but you understand. The owners are "playing hotel" rather than running one, which brings me to my last point. * To the service staff who all explain how much they hate working there, hate the owners, and can't wait until the owners sell it and get someone else to buy it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: smudger1980
Reviews.Content: We had originally booked to stay in the Sheraton world resort but having read the hideous reviews on this site we managed to change hotels 2 weeks before we left. Although this hotel is slightly out of the way from the parks and international drive, if you have a hire car this is not problem. Looking at some of the hotels on international drive i felt glad we had managed to change hotels and stay at the Florida Mall. It was definitely a better class hotel. If you like shopping, the location of this hotel is perfect. Situated right on top of an excellent shopping mall - i could not have asked for more. The rooms were extremely clean with large flat screen TV's. The beds were huge and so soft and comfortable to sleep in - i didnt want to come home! The room had a safe, refrigerator and the bathroom was clean and nicely decorated. The mall offers lots of choice in food - we particularly liked Ruby Tuesday's (on the front of the mall) they had an amazing salad bar which gave us light relief away from burgers and fries!! Smokey Bones (in front of the mall car park) also did amazing ribs. For breakfast we tried all the buffet breakfast chains and we thought that the Golden Corral offered the best value and the most choice. Ponderosa was cheap but the food was not great. The hotel reception were extremely helpful and gave us directions to where ever we wanted to go and provided us with helpful maps and park information. Tip for the parks - if you get to the parks by 8.30am you can get straight on all the rides with no queues and be out of the parks by lunchtime when it gets frustratingly busy. This gives you the afternoon to rest by the pool or do some more shopping!! If i was to go back to Orlando again i would definitely consider staying at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful. The rooms are spacious & clean. This is definetely a step up from your everyday hotel but is affordable. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Florida Hotel Is Superb”
Reviews.Author: rocialle
Reviews.Content: This hotel has now been renamed. It is now called the Florida Hotel And Conference Center. Have just stayed there for 10 nights and it is absolutely superb. Rooms are beautifully furnished with LCD flat screen tv on the wall. Directly attached to the florida mall which has an excellent selection of shops and restaurants. Hotel has new starbuck's in the lobby area which is very good indeed. Loads of free parking available or valet parking for $10 per day. No need to worry about vehicle security as mall security vehicles patrol the car parks 24/7. You can look out of the window at any time of the day or night and they are constantly patrolling so security is really not an issue. It's not on international drive, but that's half the appeal of this place. It has everything you could possibly want and a whole lot more, yet it's really quiet at the same time. It's only 10 minutes from the airport and you can get to I-drive in 10 minutes also. Would i stay there again? Most definitely..... I only paid Â£44 per night and it was an absolute steal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Florida Mall Hotel for an event held there. It was fabulous! Rooms were very clean and nice. Beds were very confortable. And, it has flat screen tvs! And for a great price! Service was very good. Great location-its connected to the lovely Florida Mall. I had a very enjoyable stay and I hope to return someday! I highly reccomend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great one night stay...planning on a full week return this year!”
Reviews.Author: MarkSC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had decided to drive down a day early and lucked upon the Florida Mall Hotel. By far the most comfortable beds we've slept in in all of our trips to Orlando. We stayed at Disney last year, but had wished we'd stayed at FMH instead. Though Disney property's have the Disney factor, you soon forget about it after a sleepless night on a hard mattress. This year we are spending our entire trip at FMH and really look forward to it. We're regular visitors of the Florida Mall anyway while we're down, so this'll be a great way to be at the Mall already. Especially on those days we'll want a break from the parks. Get up, go for a morning walk through the mall, grab some java, visit a store or two, eat lunch at the great food court, etc.

HotelInfo.Name: The Florida Hotel and Conference Center
HotelInfo.Address: 1500 Sand Lake Road, Orlando, FL 32809
